description: DB2 v12.1 System Catalog Metadata - Complete reference for SYSCAT, SYSIBM, SYSIBMADM tables with definitions, columns, relationships, and query patterns
purpose: Reference file for building and validating SQL statements in db2_12.1_sql_statements.json. NOT loaded by application at runtime.
usage_notes: This file is a REFERENCE ONLY - used by developers/AI to understand DB2 system catalog structure
Use this to verify column names, data types, and relationships when creating new SQL statements
All application SQL statements must be defined in db2_12.1_sql_statements.json, not here
When adding support for a new database provider, create a similar <provider>_<version>_system_metadata.json file
notes: SYSCAT views are read-only views of the underlying SYSIBM tables
SYSIBM contains the actual base tables for the system catalog
SYSIBMADM contains administrative views for monitoring and management
CHAR columns often contain trailing spaces - always use TRIM()
This file is used for IntelliSense, code generation, and documentation
Other providers: PostgreSQL uses pg_catalog/information_schema, Oracle uses ALL_/DBA_/USER_ views, SQL Server uses sys schema

schemas.SYSCAT: System catalog views - read-only views for metadata queries
schemas.SYSIBM: System base tables - underlying tables for SYSCAT views
schemas.SYSIBMADM: Administrative views - monitoring and performance views
schemas.SYSSTAT: Statistics views - updateable statistics for optimizer

SYSCAT.SCHEMATA.description: Contains one row for each schema in the database

DEFINER.description: Authorization ID that created the schema

SYSCAT.TABLES.description: Contains one row for each table, view, alias, or materialized query table

TYPE.description: T=Table, V=View, A=Alias, S=MQT, G=Created temp, H=Hierarchy, L=Detached, N=Nicknames, U=Typed, W=Typed view

BASE_TABSCHEMA.description: For aliases, schema of base table

BASE_TABNAME.description: For aliases, name of base table

STATS_TIME.description: Time when statistics were last updated

KEYCOLUMNS.description: Number of columns in primary key

KEYINDEXID.description: Index ID of primary key index

PCTFREE.description: Percentage of page to leave free

ACCESS_MODE.description: F=Full access, N=No access, D=Deferred, R=Read only

SYSCAT.COLUMNS.description: Contains one row for each column of a table, view, or nickname

SYSCAT.VIEWS.description: Contains one row for each view in the database

DEFINER.description: Authorization ID that created the view

notes: CRITICAL: SYSCAT.VIEWS does NOT contain REMARKS or ALTER_TIME - must join to SYSCAT.TABLES for these

SYSCAT.INDEXES.description: Contains one row for each index in the database

DEFINER.description: Authorization ID that created the index

FIRSTKEYCARD.description: Distinct values of first key column

SYSCAT.INDEXCOLUSE.description: Contains one row for each column in an index key

SYSCAT.TABCONST.description: Contains one row for each table constraint (primary, unique, check, foreign key)

SYSCAT.KEYCOLUSE.description: Contains one row for each column in a key constraint (PK, UK, FK)

SYSCAT.REFERENCES.description: Contains one row for each referential constraint (foreign key)

DELETERULE.description: A=No action, C=Cascade, N=Set null, R=Restrict

SYSCAT.CHECKS.description: Contains one row for each check constraint

SYSCAT.TRIGGERS.description: Contains one row for each trigger in the database

SYSCAT.ROUTINES.description: Contains one row for each routine (stored procedure, function, method)

TEXT.description: Source code text for SQL routines

SYSCAT.ROUTINEPARMS.description: Contains one row for each parameter of a routine

SYSCAT.PACKAGES.description: Contains one row for each package in the database

SYSCAT.STATEMENTS.description: Contains one row for each SQL statement in a package
notes: For long statements, TEXT is split across multiple rows with different SEQNO values

SYSCAT.SEQUENCES.description: Contains one row for each sequence in the database

SYSCAT.TABLESPACES.description: Contains one row for each tablespace in the database

DATATYPE.description: A=All, L=Long/LOB, T=Tables, U=User temp, S=System temp

DROP_RECOVERY.description: Y=Table can be recovered after drop

SYSCAT.DATATYPES.description: Contains one row for each data type (built-in and user-defined)

SOURCESCHEMA.description: Schema of source type (for distinct types)

METATYPE.description: S=Structured, R=Reference, D=Distinct, A=Array, C=Cursor, W=Row

VALCOUNT.description: Count of rows with this value

notes: Used to determine user permission level (DBA, Middle, Low) in the application

SYSCAT.ROUTINEDEP.description: Contains dependencies of routines on other objects

SYSCAT.VIEWDEP.description: Contains dependencies of views on other objects

SYSCAT.TABDEP.description: Contains dependencies of tables on other objects

SYSCAT.TRIGDEP.description: Contains dependencies of triggers on other objects

SYSCAT.PACKAGEDEP.description: Contains dependencies of packages on other objects

table_relationships.description: Each table can have multiple indexes
Views are in both TABLES and VIEWS (TABLES has REMARKS, ALTER_TIME)
Each table can have multiple constraints
Each key constraint has multiple columns
FK constraints FROM this table (child table)
FK constraints TO this table (parent table)
Each table can have multiple triggers
Each package has multiple SQL statements
Each column can have multiple statistics entries
Multiple tables can share a tablespace

dependency_relationships.description: Objects that this view depends on
Objects that this routine depends on
Objects that this trigger depends on
Objects that this package depends on
Objects that this table depends on (MQTs, typed tables)

find_all_dependencies_on_table.description: Find all objects that depend on a specific table
find_all_dependencies_on_table.sql: SELECT 'VIEW' AS DEP_TYPE, VIEWSCHEMA, VIEWNAME FROM SYSCAT.VIEWDEP WHERE BSCHEMA = ? AND BNAME = ? AND BTYPE = 'T' UNION ALL SELECT 'ROUTINE', ROUTINESCHEMA, ROUTINENAME FROM SYSCAT.ROUTINEDEP WHERE BSCHEMA = ? AND BNAME = ? AND BTYPE = 'T' UNION ALL SELECT 'TRIGGER', TRIGSCHEMA, TRIGNAME FROM SYSCAT.TRIGDEP WHERE BSCHEMA = ? AND BNAME = ? AND BTYPE = 'T' UNION ALL SELECT 'PACKAGE', PKGSCHEMA, PKGNAME FROM SYSCAT.PACKAGEDEP WHERE BSCHEMA = ? AND BNAME = ? AND BTYPE = 'T'

find_foreign_key_details.description: Find detailed FK relationships with column information
find_foreign_key_details.sql: SELECT TRIM(fk.TABSCHEMA) AS CHILD_SCHEMA, TRIM(fk.TABNAME) AS CHILD_TABLE, TRIM(fk.CONSTNAME) AS FK_NAME, TRIM(fk.REFTABSCHEMA) AS PARENT_SCHEMA, TRIM(fk.REFTABNAME) AS PARENT_TABLE, TRIM(kcu.COLNAME) AS FK_COLUMN, TRIM(pkcu.COLNAME) AS PK_COLUMN, kcu.COLSEQ AS COLUMN_POSITION FROM SYSCAT.REFERENCES fk JOIN SYSCAT.KEYCOLUSE kcu ON TRIM(fk.TABSCHEMA) = TRIM(kcu.TABSCHEMA) AND TRIM(fk.TABNAME) = TRIM(kcu.TABNAME) AND TRIM(fk.CONSTNAME) = TRIM(kcu.CONSTNAME) JOIN SYSCAT.KEYCOLUSE pkcu ON TRIM(fk.REFTABSCHEMA) = TRIM(pkcu.TABSCHEMA) AND TRIM(fk.REFTABNAME) = TRIM(pkcu.TABNAME) AND TRIM(fk.REFKEYNAME) = TRIM(pkcu.CONSTNAME) AND kcu.COLSEQ = pkcu.COLSEQ WHERE TRIM(fk.TABSCHEMA) = ? AND TRIM(fk.TABNAME) = ? ORDER BY kcu.COLSEQ

find_incoming_foreign_keys.description: Find tables that reference this table (incoming FKs)
find_incoming_foreign_keys.sql: SELECT TRIM(R.TABSCHEMA) AS CHILD_SCHEMA, TRIM(R.TABNAME) AS CHILD_TABLE, TRIM(R.CONSTNAME) AS FK_NAME, TRIM(R.FK_COLNAMES) AS FK_COLUMNS, TRIM(R.PK_COLNAMES) AS PK_COLUMNS, TRIM(R.DELETERULE) AS DELETE_RULE FROM SYSCAT.REFERENCES R WHERE TRIM(R.REFTABSCHEMA) = ? AND TRIM(R.REFTABNAME) = ? ORDER BY R.TABSCHEMA, R.TABNAME

find_table_statistics.sql: SELECT TRIM(T.TABSCHEMA) AS SCHEMA, TRIM(T.TABNAME) AS TABLE_NAME, T.CARD AS ROW_COUNT, T.NPAGES AS DATA_PAGES, T.FPAGES AS TOTAL_PAGES, T.OVERFLOW AS OVERFLOW_RECORDS, T.COLCOUNT AS COLUMN_COUNT, T.STATS_TIME, T.ALTER_TIME, TRIM(T.TBSPACE) AS TABLESPACE FROM SYSCAT.TABLES T WHERE TRIM(T.TABSCHEMA) = ? AND TRIM(T.TABNAME) = ?

find_index_statistics.description: Get index statistics for optimization analysis
find_index_statistics.sql: SELECT TRIM(I.INDSCHEMA) AS INDEX_SCHEMA, TRIM(I.INDNAME) AS INDEX_NAME, TRIM(I.TABSCHEMA) AS TABLE_SCHEMA, TRIM(I.TABNAME) AS TABLE_NAME, I.UNIQUERULE, I.NLEAF AS LEAF_PAGES, I.NLEVELS, I.FIRSTKEYCARD, I.FULLKEYCARD, I.CLUSTERRATIO, I.CLUSTERFACTOR, I.SEQUENTIAL_PAGES, I.DENSITY, I.STATS_TIME, I.LASTUSED FROM SYSCAT.INDEXES I WHERE TRIM(I.TABSCHEMA) = ? AND TRIM(I.TABNAME) = ? ORDER BY I.INDNAME

find_unused_indexes.description: Find indexes that may be unused
find_unused_indexes.sql: SELECT TRIM(I.INDSCHEMA) AS SCHEMA, TRIM(I.INDNAME) AS INDEX_NAME, TRIM(I.TABNAME) AS TABLE_NAME, I.UNIQUERULE, I.LASTUSED, I.CREATE_TIME FROM SYSCAT.INDEXES I WHERE I.UNIQUERULE = 'D' AND (I.LASTUSED IS NULL OR I.LASTUSED < CURRENT DATE - 90 DAYS) ORDER BY I.INDSCHEMA, I.INDNAME

check_if_fk_is_indexed.description: Check if foreign key columns have matching index for performance
check_if_fk_is_indexed.sql: SELECT R.CONSTNAME, R.TABSCHEMA, R.TABNAME, R.FK_COLNAMES, I.INDNAME FROM SYSCAT.REFERENCES R LEFT JOIN SYSCAT.INDEXES I ON TRIM(R.TABSCHEMA) = TRIM(I.TABSCHEMA) AND TRIM(R.TABNAME) = TRIM(I.TABNAME) WHERE TRIM(R.TABSCHEMA) = ?
check_if_fk_is_indexed.notes: Match index COLNAMES with FK_COLNAMES to verify coverage. Unindexed FKs can cause performance issues.

list_all_syscat_tables.description: Query to list all SYSCAT views with column counts
list_all_syscat_tables.sql: SELECT TRIM(T.TABNAME) AS VIEW_NAME, T.COLCOUNT, TRIM(T.REMARKS) AS DESCRIPTION FROM SYSCAT.TABLES T WHERE TRIM(T.TABSCHEMA) = 'SYSCAT' AND T.TYPE = 'V' ORDER BY T.TABNAME

get_columns_for_syscat_view.description: Query to get column definitions for a SYSCAT view
get_columns_for_syscat_view.sql: SELECT TRIM(C.COLNAME) AS COLUMN_NAME, TRIM(C.TYPENAME) AS DATA_TYPE, C.LENGTH, C.SCALE, C.NULLS, TRIM(C.REMARKS) AS DESCRIPTION FROM SYSCAT.COLUMNS C WHERE TRIM(C.TABSCHEMA) = 'SYSCAT' AND TRIM(C.TABNAME) = ? ORDER BY C.COLNO

critical_notes: ALWAYS use TRIM() on CHAR columns when comparing or displaying values
SYSCAT.VIEWS does NOT contain REMARKS or ALTER_TIME - MUST join to SYSCAT.TABLES
SYSCAT.STATEMENTS may have TEXT split across multiple rows (different SEQNO values)
For packages, ALWAYS join PKGSCHEMA AND PKGNAME (not just name)
BTYPE in dependency views indicates the type of object being depended on
CARD = -1 means statistics have not been collected
NULLS = 'Y' means nullable, 'N' means NOT NULL
Index COLNAMES are prefixed with +/- for ASC/DESC
